Great to hear from you! I just searched through the ICMA site and found a few great resources on municipal rent-able property practices being carried out today that I think you may find helpful.

Very best,
James Davidson

answers.text:
Hey Susanna,
The City of Newport News recently implemented an inspection program for hotels/motels within our City; however, we do not have an inspection process in place for rental properties or apartments, though that has been evaluated in the past.  
For our hotel/motel inspections, the answers to your questions are as follows:
• What is the frequency of inspections - Once per year.  If a property has no issues for two consecutive years, the inspection frequency moves to every three years.
• Are the inspections completed by city staff or contracted - City staff 
• What is the charge for inspections - $100 per application for a hotel/motel permit (which prompts the inspection).  For establishments without issues, this would amount to $100 every three years.
• What do you inspect or how complete are the inspections?  Codes Compliance inspects for building structure/maintenance and sanitary conditions, the Fire Department conducts its annual Fire Code inspection,  and the Police Department assesses the crime stats for that property from the previous year and makes security suggestions (if warranted).  We typically inspect 10% of the rooms, but if there are major issues, we may inspect the entire property.
I hope this is helpful. If you have any additional questions about our program, please feel free to contact me directly.
Flave H. Rogers 
Management Analyst  
Office of the City Manager 
2400 Washington Avenue 
Newport News, VA 23607 
Direct Line: (757) 926-3681
frogers@nngov.com

author: Susanna Wilson
text:
Hello!  Does your city license rental properties?  Do you require inspections of rental units?  If yes, 
•  What is the frequency of inspections, 
•  Are the inspections completed by city staff or contracted, 
•  What is the charge for inspections, and 
•  What do you inspect or how complete are the inspections?
Thank you for your help.  I would appreciate any information that you would have to share on the pros and cons of your existing programs.  
Please feel free to contact me with any questions. 
Sincerely,
Susanna Wilson
City of West St. Paul
1616 Humboldt Avenue
West St. Paul, MN 55118
651-552-4144
swilson@cityofwsp.org
